vclaim: He says that the crisis representative played the role of the shooting victim and the mothers of the shooting victims in Las Vegas, Orlando and the Alf Oaks.
date: stated on August 8, 2019 in a post on Facebook:
title: No, the same woman didn't pretend to be a shooting victim and the mothers of the shooting victims.
text: The mass shooting is regularly accompanied by allegations that the shootings of survivors and family members of the victims are "crisis representatives." In fact, these distortions against survivors of the shooting at Mariory Stoneman Douglas High School in Parkland, Florida, got a polyte fruit lie for the year 2018. Unfortunately, the old playbook is still the same: the mass shootings in El Paso and Dayton, Ohio, touched a new round of social media bulletins claiming that actors in crisis situations were many in the wake of the mass shooting. A photo posted on Facebook on 8 August depicting three women in error indicates that they are the same woman who plays the role of the shooting victim and the mothers of the shooting victims. "So you know not only that it was my mother from California and the Orlando shots, but it was Vistim (e.g.) from Las Vegas shooting too!" The picture says it's followed by three sarcasms while yelling. The accounts that were posted on the post took the claim even further. Someone suggested that the woman photographer looked like "the alleged mother of the girl who was supposed to have been killed in Charlottesville." Another situation was "in Boston Marathon, facing Levi Fennicom in Oregon, and in Sandy Hawk." This article was referred to as part of Facebook's efforts to combat false news and misleading information in its news broadcast. ∙ (Read more about our partnership with Facebook.) This is because the picture is a collection of images of three different women. Facebook was published on January 11, 2021 in Facebook by Nancy Belusi, who was no longer the Speaker of the House of Representatives by Samantha Buterman: January 12, 2021. The woman at the bottom of the right is Christine Lennonen, who killed her son Christopher during the shooting at the Orlando Night Pulse Club, which left 50 dead in 2016. In the first picture, the woman was Jean Lambourne, who was among those who fired on Route 91 of the Festival of Music in the Harvest Country in Las Vegas, which left 59 dead and hundreds wounded in 2017. The woman at the bottom of the left picture is Susan Schmidt-Orfanus, whose son, Telemachus "Till" Orfanos, survived shooting Las Vegas only to die during the shooting at a bar in the Los Angeles suburb of 1,000 Oaks, which left 13 dead in 2018. In Facebook, the three women have light skin and wear glasses. They all have brown hair and glasses, but they don't look the same. The search for other images of women, in which they are not coerced, and in some cases they do not wear glasses, the differences are even more acute. Lennonen has been in the public eye since the shooting, speaking at the National Democratic Congress 2016, for example. Lambourne showed up on the deal or not. The three women are different individuals who have suffered close gun violence. We're assessing this Facebook Pants on fire.
